metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7445 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
convert.c in OpenJPEG before 2.1.2 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) viavectors involving the variable s.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7445` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
No subscription required

libopenjpeg-java - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
libopenjpeg5 - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
openjpeg-tools - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
openjpip-dec-server - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
openjpip-server - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
openjpip-viewer - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
openjpip-viewer-xerces - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
openjpeg package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
